title.bibl: El Nacional, July 22, 1933. Picnic Given by La Sociedad Espanola De Chicago

div.bibl: El Nacional, July 22, 1933. PICNIC GIVEN BY LA SOCIEDAD ESPANOLA DE CHICAGO

body.p: Tomorrow, Sunday, La Sociedad Espanola de Chicago, will celebrate its first picnic of the Summer season in the well known Natoma Park, located at Milwaukee and Devon Avenues.
There will be different kinds of games and various races; we believe also that prizes will be awarded to the winners.

The dance music will be provided by the well known orchestra, "Los Mayas." The Spanish-Mexican music as well as the Cuban music, which the orchestra will play will no doubt be appreciated by the public.
The admission prices are fifty cents for gentlemen and twenty-five cents for ladies. Children free. The dance hall and the refresment room afford shelter in case of rain.
